intro: Pentodon pentandrus var. minor, commonly known as the small-flowered pentodon, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a smooth texture. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in humid environments.
